official-title.#text: To require the Attorney General to make competitive grants to State, tribal, and local governments to establish and maintain witness protection and assistance programs.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Witness Security and Protection Grant Program Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
In this section—

term.#tail: means a State, tribal, or local government that applies for a grant under this section; and

text.#text: the term

term.#tail: have the meaning given those terms in

text.#text: the terms

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Witness Security and Protection Grant Program Act of 2013/s:2/ss:j

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall make competitive grants to State, tribal, and local governments to establish or maintain programs that provide protection or assistance to witnesses in court proceedings involving—

text.#text: Subject to
a homicide, serious violent felony, or serious drug offense; or
gangs or organized crime.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall evaluate applicants based upon the following:

text.#text: In making grants under this section, the
The extent to which the applicant lacks infrastructure to support programs that provide protection or assistance to witnesses.
The prevalence of witness intimidation in the jurisdiction of the applicant.
The percentage of cases not prosecuted by the applicant due to witness intimidation.
The number of homicides per capita committed in the jurisdiction of the applicant.
The number of serious violent felonies or serious drug offenses per capita committed in the jurisdiction of the applicant.
The extent to which organized crime is present in the jurisdiction of the applicant.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines appropriate.

text.#text: Any other criteria that the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to carry out this section, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Witness Security and Protection Grant Program Act of 2013/s:2/ss:j

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , upon request of a recipient of a grant under this section, shall direct the appropriate offices within the
to provide technical assistance to the recipient to the extent the
determines technical assistance is needed to establish or maintain a program that provides protection or assistance to witnesses.

text.#text: From amounts made available under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report, in such form and manner and containing such information as specified by the
, that evaluates each program established or maintained pursuant to the grant, including policies and procedures under the program.

text.#text: A recipient of a grant under this section shall submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Witness Security and Protection Grant Program Act of 2013/s:2/ss:e/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall develop best practice models to assist State, tribal, and local governments in addressing—

text.#text: Based on the reports submitted under
witness safety;
short-term and permanent witness relocation;
financial and housing assistance; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines necessary.

text.#text: any other services related to witness protection or assistance that the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Witness Security and Protection Grant Program Act of 2013/s:2/ss:e/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall disseminate the models to State, tribal, and local governments.

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after developing best practice models under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that State, tribal, and local governments should use the best practice models developed and disseminated under this subsection to evaluate, improve, and develop witness protection or witness assistance programs as appropriate.

text.#text: It is the sense of

header.#text: Rule of construction relating to sensitive information

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines—

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to require the dissemination of any information that the
is law enforcement sensitive and should only be disclosed within the law enforcement community; or
poses a threat to national security.
The Federal share of the cost of a program carried out using a grant made under this section shall be not more than 75 percent.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the non-Federal share for a program carried out using a grant made under this section may be in the form of in-kind contributions that are directly related to the purpose for which the grant was made.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Witness Security and Protection Grant Program Act of 2013/s:2/ss:f/p:2/sp:B

text.#text: Subject to
Not more than 50 percent of the non-Federal share for a program carried out using a grant made under this section may be in the form of in-kind contributions.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may use not more than 5 percent for administrative costs.

text.#text: Of amounts made available to carry out this section for a fiscal year, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—

text.#text: In making grants under this section, the
to the extent reasonable and practical, ensure an equitable geographical distribution throughout the United States of programs that provide protection or assistance to witnesses; and
give due consideration to applicants from both urban and rural areas.
